trans-unit.source: Use Active Directory for authentication in Azure App Service
trans-unit.target: Use Active Directory for authentication in Azure App Service

trans-unit.source: Learn the different authentication and authorization options for line-of-business applications that are deployed to Azure App Service Web Apps
trans-unit.target: Learn the different authentication and authorization options for line-of-business applications that are deployed to Azure App Service Web Apps

trans-unit.source: Use Active Directory for authentication in Azure App Service
trans-unit.target: Use Active Directory for authentication in Azure App Service

trans-unit.source: [Azure App Service Web Apps](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=529714) enables enterprise line-of-business application scenarios by supporting single sign-on (SSO) of users whether they access the application from your on-premises environment or the public internet.
trans-unit.target: [Azure App Service Web Apps](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=529714) enables enterprise line-of-business application scenarios by supporting single sign-on (SSO) of users whether they access the application from your on-premises environment or the public internet.

trans-unit.source: It can be integrated with [Azure Active Directory](http://azure.microsoft.com/services/active-directory/) (AAD) or an on-premises secure token service (STS), such as Active Directory Federation Services (AD FS), to authenticate your internal Active Directory (AD) users and authorize them properly.
trans-unit.target: It can be integrated with [Azure Active Directory](http://azure.microsoft.com/services/active-directory/) (AAD) or an on-premises secure token service (STS), such as Active Directory Federation Services (AD FS), to authenticate your internal Active Directory (AD) users and authorize them properly.

trans-unit.source: Zero-friction authentication and authorization
trans-unit.target: Zero-friction authentication and authorization

trans-unit.source: With a few clicks of a button, you can enable authentication and authorization for your web app.
trans-unit.target: With a few clicks of a button, you can enable authentication and authorization for your web app.

trans-unit.source: The checkbox style configuration in every Azure web app provides basic access control for your line-of-business web app.
trans-unit.target: The checkbox style configuration in every Azure web app provides basic access control for your line-of-business web app.

trans-unit.source: It does so by enforcing HTTPS and authentication to an Azure AD tenant of your choice before granting users access to your web app content.
trans-unit.target: It does so by enforcing HTTPS and authentication to an Azure AD tenant of your choice before granting users access to your web app content.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Web Apps Authentication / Authorization](http://azure.microsoft.com/blog/2014/11/13/azure-websites-authentication-authorization/).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Web Apps Authentication / Authorization](http://azure.microsoft.com/blog/2014/11/13/azure-websites-authentication-authorization/).

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] This feature is currently in preview.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] This feature is currently in preview.

trans-unit.source: Manually implement authentication and authorization
trans-unit.target: Manually implement authentication and authorization

trans-unit.source: In many scenarios, you want to customize the authentication and authorization behavior of the application, such as a login and logout page, custom authorization logic, mult-tenant application behavior, and so on.
trans-unit.target: In many scenarios, you want to customize the authentication and authorization behavior of the application, such as a login and logout page, custom authorization logic, mult-tenant application behavior, and so on.

trans-unit.source: In these cases, it may be better to configure authentication and authorization manually for greater flexibility of its features.
trans-unit.target: In these cases, it may be better to configure authentication and authorization manually for greater flexibility of its features.

trans-unit.source: Below are two main options
trans-unit.target: Below are two main options

trans-unit.source: [Azure AD](web-sites-dotnet-lob-application-azure-ad.md) - You can implement authentication and authorization for your web app with Azure AD.
trans-unit.target: [Azure AD](web-sites-dotnet-lob-application-azure-ad.md) - You can implement authentication and authorization for your web app with Azure AD.

trans-unit.source: Using Azure AD as the identity provider has the following characteristics:
trans-unit.target: Using Azure AD as the identity provider has the following characteristics:

trans-unit.source: Supports popular authentication protocols, such as [OAuth 2.0](http://oauth.net/2/), [OpenID Connect](http://openid.net/connect/), and [SAML 2.0](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/SAML_2.0).
trans-unit.target: Supports popular authentication protocols, such as [OAuth 2.0](http://oauth.net/2/), [OpenID Connect](http://openid.net/connect/), and [SAML 2.0](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/SAML_2.0).

trans-unit.source: For the complete list of supported protocols, see [Azure Active Directory Authentication Protocols](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn151124.aspx).
trans-unit.target: For the complete list of supported protocols, see [Azure Active Directory Authentication Protocols](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn151124.aspx).

trans-unit.source: Can use an Azure-only identity provider without any on-premises infrastructure.
trans-unit.target: Can use an Azure-only identity provider without any on-premises infrastructure.

trans-unit.source: Can also configure directory sync with an on-premises AD (managed on-premises).
trans-unit.target: Can also configure directory sync with an on-premises AD (managed on-premises).

trans-unit.source: Azure AD with directory sync from your on-premises AD domain enables a smooth SSO experience to your web app when AD users access from the intranet and the internet.
trans-unit.target: Azure AD with directory sync from your on-premises AD domain enables a smooth SSO experience to your web app when AD users access from the intranet and the internet.

trans-unit.source: From the intranet, AD users can automatically access the web app through Integrated Authentication.
trans-unit.target: From the intranet, AD users can automatically access the web app through Integrated Authentication.

trans-unit.source: From the internet, AD users can log into the web app using their Windows credentials.
trans-unit.target: From the internet, AD users can log into the web app using their Windows credentials.

trans-unit.source: Provides SSO to [all applications supported by Azure AD](/marketplace/active-directory/), including Azure, Office 365, Dynamics CRM Online, Microsoft Intune, and thousands of non-Microsoft cloud applications.
trans-unit.target: Provides SSO to [all applications supported by Azure AD](/marketplace/active-directory/), including Azure, Office 365, Dynamics CRM Online, Microsoft Intune, and thousands of non-Microsoft cloud applications.

trans-unit.source: Azure AD delegates management of [relying party](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Relying_party) applications to non-administrator roles, while application access to sensitive directory data must still be configured by global administrators.
trans-unit.target: Azure AD delegates management of [relying party](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Relying_party) applications to non-administrator roles, while application access to sensitive directory data must still be configured by global administrators.

trans-unit.source: Sends a general-purpose set of claim types for all relying party applications.
trans-unit.target: Sends a general-purpose set of claim types for all relying party applications.

trans-unit.source: For the list of claim types, see [Supported Token and Claim Types](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn195587.aspx).
trans-unit.target: For the list of claim types, see [Supported Token and Claim Types](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn195587.aspx).

trans-unit.source: Claims are not customizable.
trans-unit.target: Claims are not customizable.

trans-unit.source: [Azure AD Graph API](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/hh974476.aspx) enables application access to directory data in Azure AD.
trans-unit.target: [Azure AD Graph API](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/hh974476.aspx) enables application access to directory data in Azure AD.

trans-unit.source: [On-premises secure token service (STS), such as AD FS](../web-sites-dotnet-lob-application-adfs/) - You can implement authentication and authorization for your web app with an on-premises STS like AD FS.
trans-unit.target: [On-premises secure token service (STS), such as AD FS](../web-sites-dotnet-lob-application-adfs/) - You can implement authentication and authorization for your web app with an on-premises STS like AD FS.

trans-unit.source: Using on-premises AD FS has the following characteristics:
trans-unit.target: Using on-premises AD FS has the following characteristics:

trans-unit.source: AD FS topology must be deployed on-premises, with cost and management overhead.
trans-unit.target: AD FS topology must be deployed on-premises, with cost and management overhead.

trans-unit.source: Best when company policy demands that AD data be stored on-premises.
trans-unit.target: Best when company policy demands that AD data be stored on-premises.

trans-unit.source: Only AD FS administrators can configure [relying party trusts and claim rules](http://technet.microsoft.com/library/dd807108.aspx).
trans-unit.target: Only AD FS administrators can configure [relying party trusts and claim rules](http://technet.microsoft.com/library/dd807108.aspx).

trans-unit.source: Can manage [claims](http://technet.microsoft.com/library/ee913571.aspx) on a per-application basis.
trans-unit.target: Can manage [claims](http://technet.microsoft.com/library/ee913571.aspx) on a per-application basis.

trans-unit.source: Must have a separate solution for accessing on-premises AD data through the corporate firewall.
trans-unit.target: Must have a separate solution for accessing on-premises AD data through the corporate firewall.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] If you want to get started with Azure App Service before signing up for an Azure account, go to [Try App Service](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=523751), where you can immediately create a short-lived starter web app in App Service.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] If you want to get started with Azure App Service before signing up for an Azure account, go to [Try App Service](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=523751), where you can immediately create a short-lived starter web app in App Service.

trans-unit.source: No credit cards required; no commitments.
trans-unit.target: No credit cards required; no commitments.

trans-unit.source: What's changed
trans-unit.target: What's changed

trans-unit.source: For a guide to the change from Websites to App Service see: [Azure App Service and Its Impact on Existing Azure Services](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=529714)
trans-unit.target: For a guide to the change from Websites to App Service see: [Azure App Service and Its Impact on Existing Azure Services](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=529714)

trans-unit.source: For a guide to the change of the old portal to the new portal see: [Reference for navigating the preview portal](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=529715)
trans-unit.target: For a guide to the change of the old portal to the new portal see: [Reference for navigating the preview portal](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=529715)

trans-unit.source: test
trans-unit.target: test
